text: When I came out of my mom's womb, I had 'sitcom' stamped on my forehead.
author: Sean Hayes

text: I played with dolls until I was 15. My mother encouraged it because my older sister got married when she was 15, so Mom thought that the longer I stayed with dolls, the better.
author: Linda Evans

text: I'm probably a little more like my dad. But because of my mom, I never saw being a woman as being an impediment to being able to do something. She had her Ph.D. before I was born.
author: Mary Cheney

text: My brother Jim and I spent many wonderful summers working on dairy farms in Wisconsin owned by Mom's cousins, and as members of our local Boy Scout troop.
author: Peter Agre

text: When Queer Eye hit, the church told my mom they were praying for me. She said, God loves him too. And I support him 100 percent.
author: Jai Rodriguez
